refsect1.title: Proposal
refsect1.para: I propose that aromaticity is generally coded by setting a CDKConstants.ISAROMATIC flag both in the aromatic ring atoms as well as in the aromatic ring bonds.

Aromatic ring systems are not only detected by classes like org.openscience.cdk.aromaticity.HueckelAromaticityDetector, but they may also be created by parsing SMILES strings. In the latter case, no alternating single/double bond pattern is given, but the ring atom symbols are either written in lower case letters or the bond symbols indicate an "aromatic" bond.
HueckelAromaticityDetector sets these flags when it finds an aromatic ring and it also obeys these flags when searching a given structure for aromaticity.

SMILESParser will establish a bond order of 1.5 between the aromatic bonds (in order to keep the bond sum correct) and but will also set the above flag. Afterward there is the option of having another (yet to create) class establish an alternating single/double bond pattern.

refsect1.title: Reason
refsect1.para: 1. A chemical drawing and rendering program needs a flag like this in order to know when to draw a circle inside a ring instead of the alternating double/single bond pattern.
2. SMILESParser should have a simple method of setting aromaticity. Having it find a valid alternating double/single bond pattern would overload its functionality.
